channel.title: Jethoof's Digital Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in Jethoof's Digital Garden on

item.title: Brainstorm
item.description: Goal Coming up with a character interaction scene for some of my character. that is under 4k words. - I have modified it so there will be three scenes in the actual writing to make it easier perhaps I would change it later on should it gets too wordy.

item.title: Daily Prompt - 20220401
item.description: Sprinting duration: 5 min Prompts: try to write with the following words. jester glitch prank fanciful Just write! There’s a fanciful way of pulling a prank these days compared to what we did in the past since this is the age of communication and there are so many things we could do with it compared to a court jester would make fun of themselves in front of the king in the king’s court.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: So it begins, my first National November Writer’s Month Camp! But it’s hardly November you might wonder and NaNoWriMo definitely hosts this three times a year: April, July and November.

item.title: Legends
item.description: This is soon to be my growing list of YAML data for who knows why I am setting this up for other than I could potentially use it for sorting things out.

item.title: Magic
item.description: These are some of the questions I ask myself when I’m creating magic for my world. I personally like magic with rules rather than leaving it to be mystical.

item.title: NaNoWriMo - 10 min prompt
item.description: Prompt #2: Write a scene where one character lies to another. Why do they do it? Does the other character know they’re lying?

item.title: Protagonist design - Ben Wiles
item.description: Physical description Personality Ben is observant with keen interest in understanding what the other’s true intentions because he assumes people are not to by trusted.

item.title: Rules of Magic
item.description: Is there some sort of rules in your world about magic like laws of thermodynamics? A good example is from Full Metal Alchemist; laws of equilibrant exchange.

item.title: Story Overview
item.description: Ben finally struck some luck with some trades in a remote hamlet and planning to head back to his home town, however he hears a news a war has broken out and now he cannot go back the way he came from.

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Economy
item.description: Just like any resources and tools in our world, it would impact the economics of your world. Would they be rich if they can use magic because they can do more?

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Politics
item.description: And regulation entails organizational effectiveness, a chain of command, and a structure for logistical support. - Sun Tzu

item.title: Worldbuilding - Magic and Religion
item.description: Magic might be perceived as mysticism or different from divine power from deities. Here are some questions to fill in the gaps.

item.title: Worldbuilding Index
item.description: This is where I put things for worldbuilding, rules and stuff. [[worldbuilding/Worldbuilding - Magic]]

item.title: ​Prompt #3: What is your main character’s most embarrassing memory? Has it affected the things they do or the ways they interact with other characters now?
item.description: Ollie and Ben are never in good terms as long as he can remember. his brother was always sick and their father was always concerned for him more than anything.
